unnormalised: CBSE Class 10th & 12th board exams are just around the corner! Students across India are burning the midnight oil preparing. This year, the exams are scheduled to begin on 15/02/2025, and will continue till mid-March, giving students ample time to showcase their hard work. Good luck to all the students!
normalised: C-B-S-E Class tenth and twelfth board exams are just around the corner! Students across India are burning the midnight oil preparing. This year, the exams are scheduled to begin on fifteenth february two thousand and twenty five, and will continue till mid-March, giving students ample time to showcase their hard work. Good luck to all the students!

unnormalised: Many parents are a little stressed about their kids' performance, especially in tough subjects like Maths and Science. Some schools are organizing extra classes & doubt-clearing sessions. Remember kids, don't stress too much. Take regular breaks and focus on understanding the concepts. Getting above 90% is great, but your mental health is even more important!
normalised: Many parents are a little stressed about their kids' performance, especially in tough subjects like Maths and Science. Some schools are organizing extra classes and doubt-clearing sessions. Remember kids, don't stress too much. Take regular breaks and focus on understanding the concepts. Getting above ninety percent is great, but your mental health is even more important!

unnormalised: According to early reports, over 34 lakh students have registered for the Class 10 and 12 exams this year. Delhi has the highest number of candidates, followed by UP and Maharashtra. The CBSE has released the admit cards, so make sure you download them from cbse.nic.in ASAP.
normalised: According to early reports, over thirty four lakh students have registered for the Class ten and twelve exams this year. Delhi has the highest number of candidates, followed by U-P and Maharashtra. The C-B-S-E has released the admit cards, so make sure you download them from c-b-s-e dot n-i-c dot in A-S-A-P.

unnormalised: And for those appearing for competitive exams post-boards, like JEE or NEET, remember to plan your time effectively. A good score in boards (75%+) can really boost your confidence for future endeavors. All the very best from us! Remember to breathe and you've got this!
normalised: And for those appearing for competitive exams post-boards, like J-E-E or N-E-E-T, remember to plan your time effectively. A good score in boards (seventy five percent plus) can really boost your confidence for future endeavors. All the very best from us! Remember to breathe and you've got this!
